ai.summary: A short, family-friendly 1 km walk to Birnam Oak in Scotland. This easy trail weaves through a small woodland to the historic oak, offering a gentle outing suitable for all ages and a glimpse into a landmark linked to Macbeth.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly flat, well-maintained woodland path with a few roots and compact soil. Expect shaded sections, occasional benches, and gentle turns along the 1 km route.
ai.safety_notes: Dress for changeable UK weather. Paths can be muddy after rain; wear sturdy shoes. Watch footing on tree roots and uneven surfaces. Keep dogs under control and respect the site; do not climb the tree or disturb surrounding vegetation. Stay on marked paths.
recommended_gear: Sunscreen and a hat (in sunny weather)
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with particularly pleasant conditions in spring and autumn when the trees are vibrant and the weather is mild.

seo.meta_description: Discover the Birnam Oak on an easy 1 km trail in Perth and Kinross, Scotland. A short, family-friendly woodland walk to a historic tree tied to Macbeth.
